raw_text:
Lennon brands Rangers favourites
 
 Celtic's Neil Lennon admits Rangers could be considered "slight favourites" for the Old Firm CIS Cup clash, but insists his side can still win.
 
 Lennon concedes Rangers are in good form at the moment, but they have failed to beat Celtic in their last seven meetings. "Rangers are on the up and have been on a good run in recent weeks," he said. "But it's a game we believe we're capable of winning if we play our best," he told the Evening Times. "All the boys are looking forward to it because they are brilliant games to be involved in. "Without playing at the top of our game, we have still been winning matches. "At the minute, we are at the top of the league and still in with a chance of staying in Europe, so I don't think it is the crisis people have been trying to make out. "Of course, it is a concern when you are losing goals, because we have been notorious for being a team that is hard to beat and keeping clean sheets, but hopefully we are over that wee run. "Considering we lost Henrik Larsson at the end of last season, we have still been scoring a lot of goals, which is pleasing."
llama3.2:1b: Neil Lennon of Celtic admits Rangers are in good form but believes his team can still win if they play well.
They have failed to beat Celtic in their last seven meetings and are currently top of the league with a chance of staying in Europe.
llama3.2:3b: Lennon admits Rangers may be slight favourites in Old Firm CIS Cup clash, but believes Celtic can win if they play well.
He acknowledges Rangers' recent form and concerns about conceding goals, but is optimistic about the team's chances and their position in the league.
gemma2:2b: Neil Lennon believes Rangers could be considered slight favourites in the Old Firm CIS Cup clash, but Celtic is confident they can win if they play well.
Lennon acknowledges Rangers' recent form and good run, but points to their past seven losses against Celtic.
He states that despite potential concerns about conceding goals and losing key players, Celtic is still a strong team capable of winning.

Rangers are coming off a loss and should not get too comfortable with the current situation.
They have a good start this season but need to play at their best if they want to win.

Rangers are in good form and have beaten Celtic recently, despite failing to do so seven times.

Lennon notes Rangers' strong run in recent weeks but points out Celtic's seven-game winning streak against them.
He emphasizes that all players are looking forward to a "brilliant game," stressing their league position and ongoing chances of European qualification.
Despite losing Henrik Larsson last season, Lennon highlights the team’s goal-scoring ability as pleasing.
opencoder:1.5b: "The Lennon brands of Rangers favourites in the Celtic side, while admitting their opinion on this, also insists they can continue to win matches despite not being deemed as "favourites".
Lennon contends that Rangers are at an optimal point due to their recent performance and form.
However, it is important to highlight that while they have been successful, they may not always guarantee their victory in all sports.
The Celtic team has also shown impressive adaptability within the club's previous matches and could be more efficient in recent weeks."
